Posts.Content: Hi mags22,im a breast cancer survivor triple negative grade 3 (im telling you this bit as it may give mun hope to focus on positive that people do survive)im now 20mths remission.my hair started falling out 7days after my first chemo ,id already had it cut short to prepare myself.eventually i realised it had to cime off.my daughter bless her took the clippers to it i was heartbroken.she told me i was beautiful always would be,then cried when she got home.that must have been so hard for her,as it may well be for you .my partner took a razor to what was left of my hair the next day. I told myself if i had a choice between losing my hair or my life then it was a no brainer hair had to go.the following day i answered my front door and never even thought about doing so.give ur mum plenty of compliments reassure mum that its only hair and can grow back its all part of the recovery process.If im honest i only wore my wig once couldnt stand the itchy scalp. Hugs to you and mum Tracyx
Posts.Title: It's happening- hair loss

Posts.Content: Morning jives68, My heart goes out to youI had Wle and axilla lumpectomy and had to wait 3wks for results as it was Xmas 2012 .whilst I know its frustrating ,hard and all sorts is going on through your mo d in the long run its beneficial and needs to be done. Idon't know where you live , but I'm based in Leeds , at st James,s hospital they have the Robert Ogden Millan centre it could be worthwhile checking to see if they have this service at the hospital where you are getting treatment ,if so give them a call there are staff there you can talk to or give the MacMillan helpline a call don't suffer alone its good to talk and there are plenty of us here that can and will support you. I got through as you will,good luck and sending you hugs and support for your journey.stay strong even though its hardI'm a survivor ,there is a light at the end of the tunnel even though you may not think it at mo. Tracy.
Posts.Title: WLE and two re-excisions...feeling frustrated!

Posts.Content: Morning kate32,im a triple negative grade 3 survivor(saying that im waiting to go for a ct scan), having had a bone and ultrasound scan a few weeks ago.just found a large lump in centre of my chest bone just above original tumor site.i been in remission since 22nd aug 13,my chemo finished in june and rads in late july.myself same as you im constantly tired to exhaustion,im also still having constant pain under my arm lwe area and breast the whole of it and underneath on anchor scar cut.chemo and rads can cause a lot of probs later aftet treatment has finished.i had a chat with my onc last week he said its prob results of all the treatment regarding soreness he did prescribe tablets yo ease the pain .as i found like yourself evrn soft sports bras no ease.as for tiredness before treatment and cancer i was very hyperactive worked hard  helped to look after both my parents.my onc told me there is no explanation as to why im so tired they tried to give me a tablet antidrpressant to lift my mood but it didnt agree with me.go have a chat with either your gp or your bcn if the soreness continues chat with gp about the tiredness. Good luck i know how your feeling sore and frustrated. Ytracy
Posts.Title: Breast pain and low energy 8 months on.

Posts.Content: Hi Jrip, My name is Tracy im from Leeds ,i was diagnosed in nov 2012 with tnbc,stage 1,grade 3,mine was also on my c hest wall.I went through 6 mths of chemo ,the first 3 were rotten then i hit the tax omg thought i was gonna die also suffered two mild strokes and infections had stays in hospital almost felt like giving up.then had 20 sessions of rads .No its far from  easy ,but the choice is ,its either treatment and survive or none and dont.You will get through and yes people dont understand what chemo does and how you feel cos their not going through it saying that its difficult for others to watch someone they love suffer.in time you will be well and be able to have some normality back in your life again(although life never seems quite the same).I made a bucket list and have achieved some of the things ive wanted to do im a survivor and intend staying that way. Stay strong ,think positive if you have any worries call your onc or bcn they are there to help.everyone on here can help with advice or if you just need to ramble,they understand ,some of them are going through the same as you ,or have got through to the other side of cancer .you can survive this.Most importantly rest when your body tells you to ,you need strength to fight and to get you through chemo. Good luck and good wishes . Tracyx
Posts.Title: Triple negative survivors , taxotere survivors shout out

Posts.Content: Hi daft bird, YeahI agree with u  I'm 9 mths post  aggressive triple negative BC ,had 6 myths of heavy chemo and 4 full wks of rads to include a full week of large boost rads,food tastes rotten any meat or poultry all tastes the same, tea is like dishwater I was told not to eat takeaway food for fear of food poisoning whilst having treatment also only eat fruit u can peel ice bananas satsumas etc.no alcohol either. couldn't wait for treatment to end enjoyed a bottle of wine and an Indian when it had tho. Good luck and keep fighting. Tracy
Posts.Title: Time between lumpectomy and chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi genny 1312,just been reading your post.im constantly on morphine ehich causes chronic constipation,i get sachets of lactulose from my gp in orange flavour i have 4 to 4 sachets a day in a small amount of water and a hot drink to follow .it works. I was advised by my chemo nurse not to use the tablet dulcolax as they cause muscle spasms and im in enough pain with 2ruptered discs at the base of my spine one at base of my neck sciatica for four years concurrent and osteo degrnerative arthritis of the spine. Do try the lactulose. Tracy
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Hi genny 1312,just been reading your post.im constantly on morphine ehich causes chronic constipation,i get sachets of lactulose from my gp in orange flavour i have 4 to 4 sachets a day in a small amount of water and a hot drink to follow .it works. I was advised by my chemo nurse not to use the tablet dulcolax as they cause muscle spasms and im in enough pain with 2ruptered discs at the base of my spine one at base of my neck sciatica for four years concurrent and osteo degrnerative arthritis of the spine. Do try the lactulose. Tracy
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Hi meduda525 I wear a prosthetic booby in an underwired bra it fits great and stays there. I also put them in other bras that have pockets same with my bikini tops when ive been abroad. Hope this helps. Tracy
Posts.Title: Prosthetic boobs :)

Posts.Content: hi Maria s,firstly I think you have been through enough without worrying about your siblings and mum.Dont blame yourself you didn't ask for this sh!!of an illness it invited itself.you got through the worst thing you could EVER go through.your mum sounds very selfish as for your siblings their as bad .i know some people find it hard to cope with a family member having cancer nut how the hell do they think you felt and your partner and children.it doesn't cost much to pick up a phone and ask how you are,my advice is maybe write a letter to your mum telling her how you feel and that you never said you were a victim ,you weren't your a fighter.as for siblings you could do the same or arrange a family meeting to air your views take hubby with you for support.if any of that doesn't work then I would cut your losses you have your own family unit who truly love you.good luck remember your not at fault ,your mum should really pull this family together but seems to me mum could be to blame .you need to confront them ,if they choose to remain selfish thoughtless and ignorant then at least you tried.im speaking from experience not from my mum tho other friends and family members were the same with me.xx
Posts.Title: Extended family have turned their back on me

Posts.Content: Hi daisyteabag, There is nothing you can do to prevent a reoccurance just hope that it doesn't.I was diagnosed with tnbc grade 3 in Nov 2012after losing my dad and dad in law both to cancer in Nov 2011,as you can imagine my world fell apart ,my daughter partner and family were devastated .The treatment is tough and I struggled for a while after with joint pain if it continues then see your bcnurse .It scares me that nobody knows much about this type of BC so I felt that they just hoped the treatment works ,it has a high risk of coming bk as sec cancer in the brain. Or lung , what they don't tell you is that docetaxol(tax) can cause long term side effects such ad strokes although this doesn't effect everyone. Unfortunately it did me I had a mild stroke during treatment last April and I came out of hospital this march after a week having suffered another 3. Doctors have told meI could have a major stroke at anytime and no point worrying about it as if its going to happen it will I'm on meds to try prevent it but I live everyday frightened that it could be my last. My advice is live for today don't put off till tomorrow I've been to see Ali Campbell from ub40 live, I'm going abroad in sept and I'm still here to see my grandson turn 9 today.If this lousy disease decides to turn up again I'm gonna kick it up the ass just like I've already done ad you will also. Stay strong be positive live love be happy and enjoy make every moment count . Hugs and good luck enjoy your life. Tracy on't put off till tomorrow t
Posts.Title: Triple negative

Posts.Content: Hi again Maria,s try asking mum how she would feel if she had been the one diagnosed with breast cancer or any type of cancer,would she have wanted your love and support? Would mum have been thinking at the time I'm not the only one! Would she have been hurt if you had said to her get on with it or stop acting like a victim your not the first.some people don't understand what capabilities this disease has and it's effects during and after also not only the visual scarring nut the mental scars it leaves too.
Posts.Title: Extended family have turned their back on me

Posts.Content: Hi ali,its your forum and txt mate,i was 6 weeks after chemo finished then started rads.They like to give ur body a rest so you can get se strength and energy back before radiotherapy starts. Hope your ok hun and not in any pain and sleeping a bit better . Hugs to you Tracy x
Posts.Title: surgery date

Posts.Content: Morning all, Im just gonna ramble and get all off my chest my head is in bits.I've been through a lot in my life and although I've achieved plenty I've had a lot of bad happen to me.more so from 94.(the year). I watched my grandmother die of cancer in august that year I was raped then lost my baby valentines day 95, my younger brother who was 28 went to work and never came home(he was crushed to death) my parents and family were devastated my dad had a major breakdown ended up having electric treatment schizophrenia onset of Parkinson's mum stayed strong and did all she could with my help. Dad got prostate cancer in July 2011 by 7th October it was everywhere dad died hallowed eve the same year he was scared and just before he passed the last words he said to me were please don't leave me.. After dad passed mum s tarted getting really I'll ,it seems to be grief that's made her worse .she has chro ice cops.I then in 2012 was diagnosed with tnbc,I went through hell with treatment to include 4 mild strokes.mum has just come out of hospital yest on her discharge notes it says she's had heart failure now I'm goi g to have to get help the aged involved to try get mum some quality of life for time she's got left. I feel as though I'm going to have it all to do.my brother is at work all the time my other brother lives up in Scotland with his family( he does get down as he's here now). I. So tiredI'm on morphine because I have bad lower back problems I'm waiting to see surgeons,although I can just fall asleep anywhere I can't sleep at night,I'm sick of being in pain I have to go back and see neurological team as I'm still getting signs of strokes I'm having bad nightmares so I dare not go to sleep as that's how I went into strokes( they say nightmares and headaches)are the bodies way of waking you up ad a warning.to top the lot I'm terrified the cancer is going to come back I'm trying to stop smoking (I have cut down), My mum is so stubbornI'm scarred we are going to find her dead one day Advice anyoneI'm tired out I'm getting to the end of my teather I can't be bothered anymore . Sorry to write such a sad and long story . Love to all you lovely people out there. Tracy
Posts.Title: im so tired can someone help me please.

Posts.Content: My favourite xmas song is all i want for christmas is you by mariah carey, but i also love stay another day by east 17 as it reminds me of my younger brother who we lost in 95, also blue christmas by elvis.
Posts.Title: whats your fave xmas song lovely ladies ?

Posts.Content: Hi dreamtheif, Just saw your post (bunp)and i was just going to post and tell you that i placed this reply ages ago.was just wondering where it had gone. Ive been totally honest and i hope i havent upset anyone ,but i think its only fair to tell it how it is .when i began my treatment i was terrified and didnt know what to expect and was only told small detatails.I didnt know about this fab forum only came across it after my treatment had finished.just to let you know im coming up to my first milestone this sat i will have been cancer free for two years .yippee!!!! Lets hope i stay in nedys club. Tracy xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere and Cyclophosamide (TC)

Posts.Content: Hi dreamtheif Ive posted a few replys yest and there not appearing up on my emails one was for the tax and c which you found the other was to a lady the post was titled newbie!!! Any info on why i cant find them ? Many thanks  Tracyxx
Posts.Title: Taxotere and Cyclophosamide (TC)

Posts.Content: Morning Jacko64, Just wondering how you got on with the welfare rights and the MacMillan team!did you call them and ask about the grant ? Did you get I. Touch with welfare rights at all? Regards, Tracy.
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi all I'm so happy that you received the grant from ma Millan ,I didn't know about it till I was told .So much is take. from us having treatment and our partners and family its good to get something back. I. So gladI mentioned it on the forum and I hope you all enjoy. Good luck. Health and happiness wished to all. Tracy
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi ljstar 21, My name is tracy and your in the rght place,i was diagnosed in nov 2012 also with grade 3 breast cancer mine was triple negative. Its quite normal and unselfish of you to feel the way you do at this moment ,your juggling your feelings as you want to support mum and feel you have no one to talk to Have you tried to talk to mum?as mum is probably scared to talk to you as she doesnt want to worry you more than you already are. I had chemo and its not a walk in the park,in the end its mums decision to have chemo or not,but it would be in her best interests to do so. All you can do is support mum in her decision and be there for her try to talk to mum about how your feeling or maybe you could talk to george and jackie on this forum or dreamthief they are full of information. I hope i have been of some help to you,if you need anyone to chat to ,unload on or advise please ask for it on this forum their a great bunch and were all here to help and support one another. Remember i survived cancer kicked its ar!! As have a lot of ladies and gents here.Im sure with the right guidance your mum will too shes had the op the cancer has been eliminated the chemo and rads are there as a precaution to ensure no little bits have gone astray. Good luck sending you hugs and strength for you mum and familyxx
Posts.Title: Newbie - feeling useless

Posts.Content: Hi Rosalyn , Its the MacMillan helpline number it should be in your little booklets you were given at hospital its an 0800 number I've not got it at hand but hope this helps. Tracy
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Morning Rosalyn, Did you contact MacMillan about the help with the grant  if yes did you get help? A lot of cancer patients don't k ow about this , if I remember I was told when I rang ma Millan for advise, they also told me I could have one white kitchen appliance ie  cooker washing machine,tumble dryer or microwave if any of my appliances had broken ,as it happens my dryer had broken . Let me know how you got on , Regards, Tracy.
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi bailey108, My name is tracy ,im almost 2yrs in remission 22/8/15. I was diagnosed with triple negative bc in nov 2012 my stage was 1 and i was grade 3 so it was very aggressive i was told. I had c and tax. I was offered the cold cap too . I had 6 sessions of chemo followed by 20 sessions of radiotherapy.the first 3 sessions i had c ,it was pretty rough side effects include sickness upset tummy headaches tiredness weightloss but these side effects dont happen to everyone it all depends on the dosage of chemo you are given.hair loss happened for me even after i tried the coldcap but that doesnt happen to everyone some people just get that their hair thins. The taxotere is a whole different ball game side effects are pains in the large bones tiredness you could lose your toe and fingernails too. You can get mouthwash and use bonjela for mouth ulcers and thrush some hospitals provide these items. With the tax you can also have bad reactions to it so you are given steroids to start taking the eve before and on the morning of your chemo.i was given an injection 24 hours after my tax into my stomach by my partner then everyday for another four days after that. I hope this has helped you but if you have any doubts speak to your bcn or chemo nurse you should see her a week prior to your treatment.Im sorry if this seems scarey but i would rather be honest than not. Good luck with treatment stay strong eat well and avoid takeaway foods .only eat fruit that you can peel avoid anyone with colds sore throats or any infection. You will get through this and everyone is here to help comfort and give you advice. Its a hard battle but im positive you will do it. Tracyxx
Posts.Title: Taxotere and Cyclophosamide (TC)

Posts.Content: Oh another one of my very favourites is please come home for christmas by jon bon jovi.love that song .x
Posts.Title: whats your fave xmas song lovely ladies ?

Posts.Content: Morning Anne Im a tnbc survivor ,2 yrs remission on 22/8/15. Im based in Leeds and have had a yearly mammogram each year since my treatment stopped,saying that i have had many probs.nothing has been mentioned here about cut backs and im hoping it doesnt happen.The government have no right to play god ,checkups screening are important they save lives,there are a lot of women and men out there who dont regularly check themselves and if they do then tend to ignore. Good luck for the future and im so glad that you have got to the end of the tunnel that was your journey. As dreamthief said keep posting it gives others a great strength of selfworth and belief that we can beat cancer. Tracyxx
Posts.Title: One year check - discharged!

Posts.Content: Hi Jacko64, As far asI know it is not means tested but don't take my words as truth you will get to know more when you call helpline. If you are on meds then that to me is as equal to treatment as being treated with intravenous . LikeI said earlier give them a call you won't know till you try. Best wishes Tracy
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi jacko64, Think you just ring them atMacMillan and ask. Tracyl
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi jacko64, Get in touch with your local welfare rights office and ask if they can get a MacMillan support worker to come out to you ,explain your circumstances ,they will make an appointment for someone to come out and fill in all the relevant forms for you. They will takeyour phone number and Macmillan support worker will phone you. If youcan try and get letters from your gp and oncologist with details of all your treatment also any past appointment s you have had and ones to follow (letters) get them altogether so that when MacMillan co.e out to see you they can send SD my h I for in with your form as possible. Did you know you can get a grant fromMacMillan for clothing etc? Its a one off payment ring the o800 number you should have it in your booklets you got fro. Hospital . Good luck.
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi Ed4132, I had lumpectomy ,chemo and 20 courses of rads from 19/12/12 till july 2013. I still have tenderness on the breast that was operated on,more so on scar tissue and under my armpit swells. Ive been back several times and been told its all normal after effects from rads.dont wear underwired bras if you can wear a sports bra.i also wear a prostethic breast implant to even myself up it just irritates when i get warm so i put baby talc in my bra cup. It does help to wear a soft cotton bra for bed as well. I cant say when the tenderness will ease ,as ive had problems for the last two years ,but everyone is different. If things continue do phone your onc or bcn and ask to see somebody.wishing you luck and a pain free future. Tracy
Posts.Title: Tender still after a year .

Posts.Content: Hi Jack 64, No its not too late if you still have the illness or you are still receiving treatment then you ring the MacMillan helpline explain your situation and ask if you can get any help ie (grant) for clothing if you are losing or gaining weight. I also am led to believe they offer you a new white appliance for your kitchen ie washing machine tumble dryer fridge . Youdon't need to worry about filling out forms just yet for DLA if its not due for renewal until next Feb but make sure you get the forms sent in  by November . Good luck
Posts.Title: dla.

Posts.Content: Hi spammie, How are u doing ?been thinking about u all day and about  the situation ur in it must be so difficult!!! My. Heart truly does go out to you, I've been in ur situation and I know its easy for people on the outside to pass comment when they r not in ur shoes ( but I do understand) only difference I didn't have cancer at the time. I too was diagnosed with tnbc a few wks before my 50th birthday ( I will never forget that birthday) I was waiting to heat from onc  For a date for surgery ,my partner and daughter hsf arranged a big patty for me . I love to sing ( ifI'm honest I think singing got me through).I was singing a song by Celine Dion titled (I'm alive) I turned to face all my family and friends and they were all crying including my partner.(I didn't k ow how advanced the cancer was and what the outcome was going to be at the time). If youever get s chance to listen to the song do . Thinking of youas I'm sure others on here are too. Hugs and strength Tracy
Posts.Title: Where do I go from here, part two

Posts.Content: Hi spammie, I really feel for you I've been in your situation my ex husband beat me and betrayed me when I realised I didn't lo e him anymore I knew what I had to do. I walked away told him I would rather be on my own and happy than live in a marriage with deciet knowing that he would change for a while then hurt me again. Yes itsgoing g to be much harder for you ad you are going through dark days at the moment with treatment ,yes your husband is caring for you at the moment but a leopard never changes its spots. I think  deep down you know what you have to do  just ask. Yourself Do you want to spend the test of your life unhappy and with someone you dont love? Or do you kick the cancer up the ass be happy and start living your life? You only get one crack at it and life is too short as all of us on this site know only too well. Only you can decide, go for what you want that's the only choice you have to make I know what I would choose. Best wishes and stay strong  If you would like to chat send me a friend request Think of your future Tracy
Posts.Title: Where do I go from here, part two

Posts.Content: Yvonne 17, I suffered badly with radiotherapy after a few days I was really sore then by the Mon of the first week my skin looked like it had been burnt with an iron.I had 3weeks every day of rads then s 4th full wrrk of stronger dose my skin and nipple area cracked and I couldn't sleep.when I saw my nurse at radiotherapy CLI ice she gave me some blue cooling gel pads I can't remember the name of them but it was like heaven when I applied them, she also gave me some dressings which you dampen with water and place them into your bra .both these worked for me so ask . Good luck Tracy.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy only day 3

Posts.Content: Morning george 76,soz afternoon looking at clock that i didnt put forward last nite lol.the markings when done are painless.mine stayed well after rads ,you just have to be careful not to wash harshly in the areas where they are.rads makes you tired but nothing compared to chemo.have you been given your treatment plan yet?this tells you how many sessions and a timetable? Have they explained or given you any creams etc?.rads can make the area very red and sore,my skin was severely burnt and very painful but i did have 20 sessions plus a week of strong booster radiotherapy as my tumor was large on the chest wall and aggressive. This doesnt happen to everyone for most its a breeze ,lets be honest compared to some chemo drugs anything is a walk in the park.if you need any info bout creams gel pads etc post on forum or pm me .if i can help i will.when i was going through treatment i didnt get much help as i didnt find this amazing forum and all the special unique people on here until well after my treatment had finished but ive made so.e lovely friends and had some good advice. Take care  Tracy
Posts.Title: immune system

Posts.Content: Hi heidi 00123,I'vee just seen your post but its dated sept 2013? Are you still having treatment ?are you anymore knowledgeable about your illness and diagnosis? I certainly don't think that anyone in oncology should be asking you to celebrate anything to do with any type of BC.I am going to send you a friendship request if you accept I can give you plenty of advice I'm a mptnbc survivor it wasn't easy getting here but I'm alive . Tracy
Posts.Title: Metaplastic breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi debts thsnkyou for your reply ,I'm definitely going to pursue my options for breast augmentation.I have done lots of research and implants can be done if sub muscular but I would be happy with lipo. The surgeonI saw said there wasn't a lot of difference to him but to me there is and will be as I put on weight as the treated breast will now stay where it is.(at least I won't have to worry about my nipple looking at my naval on that breast). Its so annoying. And upsetting when women that have been through what we have feel we have to fight to get what we feel we need,when others get surgery on NHS to pursue their career as an ESCORT ie ( Josie Cunningham) in papers recently she only lives around the corner from me,turns out she is the niece of my step uncle . Kind regards I hope you stay. Well and lucky. Tracy
Posts.Title: breast augmentation.

Posts.Content: Hi pixielooloo,I was told by my cheno nurse that i would defo lose all my hair after 1st or 2nd treatment,yet i tried the cold cap anyway.after my first chemo 9 days later my hair was falling out everywhere.i had really long curly blonde hair ,but did av it cut short just b4 treatment started.when my hair began to fall out my scalp was really sore and tender a few days later i noticed bald patches ,so i thought sod it ,its gonna all fall out anyway so i didnt use the cold cap again.ask ur chemo nurse if the treatment ur aving will def cause u to lose ur hair or not.hair lose depends on which chemo u av.to be honest the first night my daughter shaved my head i was devastated ,my partner used a razor on it the day after.but i got used to being bald .it is part of getting better and i just kept thinking its only hair it can grow back,im alive and life is something u cannot replace. Hope this helps good luck with ur treatment and stay strong.theres a light at the end of the tunnel and u will get there. Tracyx
Posts.Title: Hair & cold cap

Posts.Content: Can anyone help I'm post tnbc stage 1,grade 3, had lumpectomy and a ills dec19 2012 .  .6 months of chemo ( herceptin and tsxotere) then 4 wks 22,days in all of rads.been told I can't have implants and they won't touch my treated breast as it too much of a risk bcos of all the radiotherapy .all they said they can do is reduce my larger breast why would I want them to cut open a perfectly healthy breast? They say I can't av liporemodelling as Im not very big built so I'm left with uneven breasts which as I put on weight are going to look even worse as the treated breast will not grow bcos of all the radiotherapy, this been said, what really hurts is a friend of mine had just had exactly the same procedures and same treatment ,yet she was offered an implant or liporemodelling ,she has the remodelling done this month is it bcos she works for the NHS as a nurse that she's getting this done. Tracy
Posts.Title: breast augmentation.

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley, Thanks for your advice which I will be using ,I've been through too much and fought hard to live I'm not giving up now. Wishing you health and luck Tracy.
Posts.Title: breast augmentation.

Posts.Content: Morning Mrs D ,ladies and gents and my friend Ali owl, Yep guess what its teaming it down over here in not so sunny Leeds west yorkshire,whats happening to the weather its c!!p,for this time of year.roll on summer. Tracy.
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley, I can recall what my partner said to me during my treatment, I own a long black velvet hooded house coat ,the first timeI came downstairs in it  I had no hair and my eyes were black from chemo and lack of sleep he said I looked like uncle fester from the Adams family ( a thin version as I only weighed 6 stone). Iwon't tell you what my reply was the cheeky g!!.but have to say he was fab through all my treatment and supported me all the way.  Tracy.
Posts.Title: Another "dumb things people say" video

Posts.Content: Hi jaquelineOn.Thankyou for your reply i too have lost both parents .i lost dad in 2011 after 3mths of cancer,mum was in hospital 4 1/2 hours she was gone although it wasnt to cancer.it was ischemic bowel she died in a lot of pain after having a large seizure on top of the pain she was already in.we lost a younger brother who was crushed to death aged 28 in 1995.myself being the eldest and only sister had to sort out all mums monetary matters and organise everything else not that i minded. I just cant understand why i feel so exhausted all the time.
Posts.Title: advice please somebody

Posts.Content: i recently posted worrying about swelling and soreness in left armpit and ribcage in armpit ,also ive found a lump in the centre of my chest just below where collar bone meets also a lump in my left breast just above where the original cancer was removed (left armpit was where i had wle) two years ago.my tumor turned out to be on my chest wall and not in the breast tissue.i have been in touch with my bcn she has told me that my appointment is on its way,the other thing thats worrying is im absolubtly tired out constantly i feel done in.I lost my mum very suddenly 1/8/14 and ive not grieved very much as i have had too much to sort out.tiredness lumps swellings ,on top of grief im worried if the cancer has returned .to be blunt im fab at helping anyone and i really dont mind but my behind is beginning to fall out.any advise would be gratefully appreciated many thanks Tracyx
Posts.Title: advice please somebody

Posts.Content: Hi Joanne,I had lumpectomy and  sentinal node axilla on 19thdec 2012 .The sleepless nights in pain I just took co codamol which I had already been prescribed for back pain  maybe this may be an option short term have a word with your doctor or BC nurse.You will feel much better once you have your results as you will then know what the next step will be , I know this is tough and heartbreaking not to mention scary but you will get through this .Numbness could last for quite some time I still have no feeling under my arm and my breast ( anchor cut) is still tender 2 years on ,but hey I'm still alive !!!!. Good luck with your journey  Stay strong and think positive this will help get you through Oh and talk . Hope to hear from you soon Tracy.
Posts.Title: Sleepless nights

Posts.Content: Hi amanda jh, Bless you You must be out of your mind at at the lowest anyone could be at this moment,what Gives anyone the right to play god?its bad enough having to take in what you have already been told but not knowing wha t the future holds for yourself and your Loved ones is beyond belief. Get on the phone mon morn to ur oncologists secretary explain and demand that somebody either sees or speaks to you. They have a duty to you,you have a right to know. Be strong and demand answers.Im certain all on this forum will be behind you  to support and be there if you need to chat or advice. Its bad enough that your going through this sh!!disease make sure your told what you need and are entitled to know.keep us informed. Good luck ,strength and a big hug coming your way. Tracyxx
Posts.Title: Not sure where I belong anymore

Posts.Content: Hi katee 17,if the swelling has got worse then do as the other ladied have advised and call bcn,however,did you get given some leaflets on excercises to do?if yes do them,they are there to stop swelling hun .i had surgery on 19/12/12 did all i should and am still having probs with swelling under .y armpit and breast where i had tumor removed and axilla op. Good luck  Tracy
Posts.Title: Swollen arm/breast is it normal?

Posts.Content: Hi again susie MB, If your finding it overwhelming taking all in that your onc and bcn are telling you,i would try if pos to take someone with you to appointments that way they can take in what you just cannot at the mo. Or you could jot things down so you can recap later or ask someone to do this for you. Good luck again and post here there are lots of ladies and gents to offer a chat or advice. Tracyx
Posts.Title: Cold Caps

Posts.Content: Morning susie mb,Im a triple negative grade 3 breast cancer survivor yeahhhhh, there is a light at the end of the tunnel .your only at the beginning of this journey but you will get lots of advice and help here.The cold cap does work and as Ali Owl said its bloody freezing and chemo takes longer,i was 4 hours .However it doesnt work for everyone ,it all depends on the type grade of cancer and if its hormone responsive or negative ,there are lots of reasons .your bcn will advise you as to whether or not its worth trying .I was told by my onc that i would defo lose my hair ,but i tried the cold cap anyway ,thought it may give me a chance to keep my locks a little longer,but it didnt work for me ,i began losing my hair after my first chemo.That doesnt mean it wont work for you everyones journey is different .I would definately give it a go afterall you have to try if not then you will never know if it would have worked or not. Its your journey only you can decide ,im not going to say its easy as it isnt ,when you have a choice of losing hair ,going through the path of treatment you have to or life !!! Then i would rather be here and have no hair(as my grandson of 8 at the time said to me) its better that he had me here without hair than not at all. You will get through ,Ali owl has just celebrated another birthday and not long ago i was giving her the same advise. Stay strong ,think positive ,do as your onc advises and call the hospital or your bcn if you are unsure about anything. Thinking of you . Tracyx
Posts.Title: Cold Caps

Posts.Content: Morning Ali owl, How did your birthday go hun?did you have a fab time,lots of beers and fun?xx hope it was a good one you deserve it after all youve just achieved.isnt it a great feeling when your journey is over. Tracyxx
Posts.Title: Cold Caps

Posts.Content: Ditto!!!what a selfish ,rotten heartless git,to be honest we will never get to know the full true story .I cant imagine how all those people felt knowing that they were totally helpless. That poor mum with her baby,them poor school kids and all the others.god knows why . Godbless all whom perished .xx I hope him responsible goes straight to hell. Evil nasty lowlife.
Posts.Title: why?

Posts.Content: Hi misteymoley, Omg its bloody fabulous and very artistic he should be proud of himself how it looks and moreso for the reasons behind it. XxxTracy
Posts.Title: Charity fundraiser

Posts.Content: Hi mysteryleo, Im a triple negative grade 3 bc survivor.I had 3 months fec Then 3 months tax.I had every side effect going hair loss but that happened after my 1st fec i lost my finger and toe nails my tongue split sore mouth aching bones and severe tiredness.yet i came out the other end what males you feel really bad makes you better.just remember each treatment you have is one less to go and is keeping you alive.stay strong any worries or probs talj to your bcn or onc.There is a light at the end of the tunnel and you will get there.not everyone suffers with all the side effects you may only get a few.there are plenty of lovely people on here that are there for you so although you may feel alone your not. Good luck and hugs.x Tracy
Posts.Title: TNBC - starting FEC-T chemo regime this friday advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi 2daughters I had lumpectomy wle and lymph nodes removed on 19th dec 2012. I had bad pain for quite a long time and stil do get pain even now Under my armpit is still numb also.what bras are u wearing ?cos they Can have a great effect on healing if they are underwired kind. If u are worried i would cal ur onc or bcn just in case u av a slight Infection or even just to put ur mind at ease. Goodluck Tracyx
